title: Rubén Darío
summary: Félix Rubén García Sarmiento (January 18, 1867 – February 6, 1916), known as Rubén Darío (US: /dɑːˈriːoʊ/ dah-REE-oh,[1][2] Spanish: [ruˈβen daˈɾi.o]), was a Nicaraguan poet who initiated the Spanish-American literary movement known as modernismo (modernism) that flourished at the end of the 19th century. Darío had a great and lasting influence on 20th-century Spanish literature and journalism. He has been praised as the "Prince of Castilian Letters" and undisputed father of the modernismo literary movement.[3]
